intro: Rostellularia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins, and its inflorescences consist of clusters of brightly colored, spurred flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
